text: The first inauguration of Bill Clinton as the 42nd president of the United States was held on January 20, 1993. This was the beginning of the first term of Bill Clinton as President and Al Gore as Vice President. The ceremony took place at the United States Capitol in Washington, D.C.Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies, President William Jefferson Clinton 1993. http://inaugural.senate.gov/history/chronology/wjclinton1993.cfm (accessed May 22 2012) Clinton was the first president elected after the Cold War period. He was the first Democrat elected in 16 years. Clinton and Gore took over from outgoing President George H. W. Bush and outgoing Vice President Dan Quayle.University of Virginia, American President: A Reference Resource. http://millercenter.org/president/clinton/essays/biography/1 (accessed May 22 2012) ==References== Category:1993 in the United States Clinton, Bill Clinton, Bill Category:Bill Clinton
title: First inauguration of Bill Clinton
